text: foreign [Music] welcome back to the channel and today we are talking about one of the newest Nintendo switch games and that is doraemon's story of Seasons Friends of the Kingdom now I don't want you guys to confuse this with the first story mode story Seasons which is on the switch as well so if you are interested in this game or you kind of you know want to buy that game just make sure you're getting the right one because this second installment is better pretty much in every single way over the first which is a little spoiler how I feel about this game but I just wanted to make a note of that also in this video I am playing from my PC okay but I do want to report that the switch version looks and performs exactly the same and honestly I prefer the switch version over the PC version so with all that out of the way let's get to my first thoughts of this game so first off if you are unfamiliar with this sort of franchise this is a spin-off franchise for the story of Seasons Harvest Moon

text: with this sort of franchise this is a spin-off franchise for the story of Seasons Harvest Moon games called Doraemon story of Seasons now I'm not too familiar with Doraemon I know it's a popular Japanese cartoon so just know that you aren't going to get some of the features that you would come to expect in the mainline games such as marrying people and having deeper relationships with some of the towns people uh and that's because you play as a young boy that's another thing you can't do You Can't customize your character in every way but I do feel like when I play this game I'm not really missing those features but definitely just something to note now for me I mean this is definitely personal opinion Union but I've always thought that the Doraemon story of Seasons games look absolutely beautiful like I think these are the best looking story of Seasons games ever I just love the storybook sort of watercolor art style and these are just a pleasure to look at like when you're playing

text: sort of watercolor art style and these are just a pleasure to look at like when you're playing sometimes you just kind of stop and look at the uh look at the environments I also like how there are some Dynamic environments in this installment in the first story mon story of Seasons you were just kind of playing like a top-down view but there are some areas not everywhere but there are some areas in this game that kind of expand the world a little bit and you can kind of see in the sky and kind of see like off in the distance and I really like those Dynamic camera angles and I thought that that made this game just feel that more special now this isn't a full review I was able to play a few hours but I was able to learn the mechanics and kind of get a good feel of this game and I feel like the first few hours in games especially like this the Farm Sim genre are definitely the deal breaker so I'm kind of come comfortable with putting this out right away if you play this game just know

text: so I'm kind of come comfortable with putting this out right away if you play this game just know that it is very story heavy which is actually a good thing in this case like I said before you're missing out on some of the features such as like the marital features and things like that but in its place you are getting a ton of story which I feel like the normal story of Seasons games are actually lacking so this game the characters speak in Japanese but there are English subtitles and I gotta say it is like watching an anime and the story is actually really good in a lot of farming games you just inherit the farm from your dying grandpa or something but in this you're actually from space and you travel here and the queen actually steals some of your futuristic space equipment because she kind of is a little suspect of you so it is up to you to take care of this farm and to help the people in the town to sort of win the Queen's trust back I know this story isn't groundbreaking the

text: people in the town to sort of win the Queen's trust back I know this story isn't groundbreaking the premise isn't groundbreaking but it was kind of nice to to switch it up a little bit these story elements will happen every few days or so you will start your day and then immediately be kind of thrown into these different cut scenes and I actually did enjoy the story and I'm kind of excited to see where this story goes because it's pretty interesting I also found it pretty Charming that along with the main story of the game you are given story and backstories of the townspeople in your town so for example there's an old woman in the town that gives a lot of people advice and you can also go there to like eat and you know kind of recharge your batteries uh and then in the workshop there's a couple that is always fighting but together they make this beautiful buildings and upgrades to your house and stuff so I don't know there's a lot of farming games where I see the NPCs and they're just

text: house and stuff so I don't know there's a lot of farming games where I see the NPCs and they're just kind of there and they serve a purpose but in this game I felt a connection with these characters and uh that was pretty surprising to me in terms of the mechanics you will see some familiar tools and activities such as growing crops and growing crops in this game is pretty standard for all the story Seasons farming games you plant your seeds you can add fertilizer you can water them and of course that's only the basics uh you can get different crops for each season it's pretty standard in that regard you can do things like fish catch bugs go to the mine lines and get oars and things like that if you play these types of games you know exactly the activities to expect but this game does everything quite well of course when you start these kind of games your bag is limited your farm doesn't look great you don't have any farm animals you don't have much money or anything but that's sort of

text: look great you don't have any farm animals you don't have much money or anything but that's sort of the beauty of this game it's very grind heavy but in a good way actually one of the biggest changes from the first game to this game are the menus and I found myself loving just scrolling around the menu you can simply open up one menu and you can see your relationships you can see the map you can see your inventory the inventory is really cool too because you have a dedicated tool bag and then you have your bag pack I kind of like that how it's separated and if you did play the first game man that is uh that's definitely an upgrade there are a few other noteworthy features that I only got to really scratch the surface in my play time uh the first one being animals and this is pretty you know standard in farming games but you can take care of animals such as chicken alpacas cows and much more and I thought this was super cute I was actually able to get a chicken and of course you know

text: more and I thought this was super cute I was actually able to get a chicken and of course you know you have to take care of it feed it lays eggs you know the drill with these uh the other mode that I think you guys are really gonna enjoy is decoration mode and basically you can trigger this on your farm there's actually a little shed on there and once you click your shed you are in decoration mode and it's really cool because time actually stops and this is where you can kind of place things on your farm and if you know you are used to games like Animal Crossing and things like that this is definitely a mode that's going to keep you coming back for more there's also a tool that lets you move anything on your farm so you can use this tool to move crops over a couple squares and I feel like this is sort of a a game changer for me because when I'm decorating my farm usually I'm like wait I can't put a fence there because I already planted crops there with but with this tool you can
